oai_dc:dc.dc:title: About the use of antagonistic bacteria and fungi
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tilcher, R.
Schmidt, C.
Lorenz, D.
Wolf, G. A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Fruit and berries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Microorganisms isolated from the phylloplane of vine and cereal plants inhibiting different phytopathogenic fungi were tested as biological control agents against Plasmopara viticola (downy mildew of grapevine). Based on screening in vitro against Phytophthora infestans, P. parasitica, Pythium ultimum, Botrytis cinerea 62 bacterial isolates were selected for tests with Plasmopara viticola.. Antifungal bacterial strains were assayed for antagonistic activity towards the grapevine dieback fungus Eutypa lata in vitro and on grape wood.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Tilcher, R.; Schmidt, C.; Lorenz, D. and Wolf, G. A. (2002) About the use of antagonistic bacteria and fungi. [Untersuchungen zur Anwendung von antagonistischen Bakterien und Pilzen.] In: Boos, Markus (Ed.) 10th International Conference on Cultivation Technique and Phytopathological Problems in Organic Fruit-Growing and Viticulture. Proceedings to the Conference from 4th to 7th Feb. 2002 at Weinsberg/Germany, pp. 142-145.
